1. Continue to train all employees in Process Safety Management and the facility Safety Plan/Programs.
2. Continue to have employee involvement in Safety Plan Development.

About White Castle
White Castle System, Inc. was founded in 1921 and is a privately held business dedicated to Serving the finest products, for the least cost, in the cleanest surroundings, with the most courteous personnel.

ed its maintenance program on the industry standard: the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration (IIAR) guidelines. In particular, the IIAR 2 (ANSI/IIAR 2-2014) Standard for Safe Design of Closed-Circuit Ammonia Refrigeration Systems, is used at the facility.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
There have been no ammonia releases over the past five years at the White Castle Distributing, LLC facility meeting the definition in 40 CFR 68.42.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM
White Castle Distributing, LLC has an Emergency Action Plan in effect at the facility. The Emergency Action Plan includes all types of emergencies such as storm events, tornadoes, etc. including an ammonia release.  The Emergency Response Plan (Plan) is detailed in the Emergency Action Plan and referenced in the PSM document, which is maintained at the facility. This Plan is designed to meet the following objectives:
1.) To save lives.
2.) To minimize and avoid injuries.
3.) To protect the environment.
4.) To minimize property damage.

White Castle Distributing, LLC maintains a safety committee whose members are the designated emergency coordinators for the facility. The Plan provides the response organization and notification procedures, evacuation routes, ammonia health hazards, and mitigation procedures, which will be implemented to respond effectively to emergency situations that may arise at the facility. This Plan will be reviewed and updated at least once per year. This Plan will be reviewed and updated to ensure compliance with the PSM and RMP regulations, as well as to incorporate facility changes due to the renovation of the facility.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY
The PHA for the original ammonia refrigeration system was revalidated in February 2021, and the PHA for the new system was conducted in June 2022.  Both PHAs generated mitigation measures (recommendations) to improve safety at the White Castle Distributing, LLC facility located at 1614 Capstone Way Vandalia OH. The White Cast

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES
White Castle Distributing, LLC, (a division of White Castle System, Inc.) located in Vandalia, OH, provides refrigeration for warehousing and distribution of food and related products and services. White Castle Distributing, LLC senior management is not only committed to offer superior service, but also maintains a safety and environmental program to promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surrounding communities. White Castle Distributing, LLC will administer safety and environmental policies at the facility to ensure compliance with OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) and EPA's Risk Management Program (RMP). These programs include process hazard analysis (PHA), management of change, mechanical integrity, operating procedures and training, contractor safety, forklift safety, hazard communications, lockout/tagout and other safe work practices, employee safety manuals, manufacturers documentation, and the Emergency Response Plan.

STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE
White Castle Distributing, LLC is located at 1614 Capstone Way. The refrigeration systems are designed and constructed in accordance with all applicable federal, state, and local regulations.  The facility's systems use a total of approximately 21,480 pounds of anhydrous ammonia to provide refrigeration for warehousing and distribution of food and related products and services.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS
The White Castle Distributing, LLC ammonia refrigeration systems have many safety features. Much of the safety of the systems is inherent in the design of the systems, as well as the policies and procedures that govern the operation of the system. For example, White Castle Distributing operates and maintains the ammonia refrigeration systems in accordance with OSHA's Process Safety Management regulation.
